Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This class is obsoleted in this android platform")

Docs.summary: A client-side connection that relies on outside logic to connect sockets to the appropriate hosts.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether this connection is secure.

Docs.param: true if this connection is secure, for example if an SSLSocket is used, or false if it is not secure
parameters for this connection. The parameters will be used when creating dependent objects, for example to determine buffer sizes.
Docs.summary: Signals that the connection has been successfully open.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the unconnected socket which is about to be connected.
the target host of this connection
Docs.summary: Signals that this connection is in the process of being open.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Update(class Java.Net.Socket sock, class Org.Apache.Http.HttpHost target, bool secure, class Org.Apache.Http.Params.IHttpParams params) cil managed

Docs.param: the new socket for communicating with the target host, or null to continue using the old socket. If null is passed, helper objects that depend on the socket should be re-used. In that case, some changes in the parameters will not take effect.
the new target host of this connection
true if this connection is now secure, false if it is not secure
